page.title: 07FARMING: GENERAL
page.content: Nearly all the land in our D-block is used for farming. This is a mixture of dairy and arable. When we did our land cover investigations, we found the primary cover was usually crops other than grass followed by pasture. The pasture was used mainly by cattle, with some grazing for horses and once only for sheep. We did a class survey of square 10 with the mill in. Our 100 squares were covered like this - arable (mainly wheat or barley) 58; pasture 39; rough grazing 2; buildings 1. We think this is typical of most of the land around Marcham. There are also two big blocks of allotments.
